meanings.definition: To move slowly and quietly in order to avoid being noticed
meanings.sent1: I saw a mouse creep across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to creep up on birds.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon tried to creep into the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The fog seemed to creep in from all directions.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of the tree would creep along the wall as the sun set.

meanings.definition: A person who behaves in a strange and unpleasant way, often making others feel uncomfortable
meanings.sent1: The creepy man gave me a weird feeling.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie had a lot of creeps in it.
meanings.sent3: The creepy clown made everyone laugh instead of scream.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a creepy vibe that made me shiver.
meanings.sent5: The creepy crawly bug made me jump in surprise.

meanings.definition: A feeling of fear or disgust caused by something unpleasant or strange
meanings.sent1: The creepy noise in the dark alley scared me.
meanings.sent2: The sight of spiders gives me the creeps.
meanings.sent3: The creepy mask at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The creepy feeling of being watched sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The creepy movie left me with nightmares for days.
